intro: Barbacenia foliosa, commonly known as the velvetleaf barbacenia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, velvety leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. Barbacenia foliosa is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and open woodlands. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both ecological studies and ornamental gardening.
